org.nosco
Class TransactionThread

java.lang.Object
  org.nosco.TransactionThread

public class TransactionThread
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains is used to start, commit and roll back transactions when using this API.   Transactions are specific to both the DataSource and the current thread.   Typical use would be like the following (where db.DEFAULT is the data source generated by the CodeGenerator): 

   TransactionThread.start(db.DEFAULT);
   SomeClass x = SomeClass.ALL.get(SomeClass.ID.eq(123));
   x.setName("my new name");
   x.update();
   doSomeOtherWork();
   SomeClass.ALL.where(SomeClass.ID.eq(456)).deleteAll();
   TransactionThread.commit(db.DEFAULT);
If any of the SQL calls failed (throwing a SQLException), the transaction would be rolled back.   Note that database calls in doSomeOtherWork() will also be within this transaction (as long as they're still within the same thread).

Author:
Derek Anderson
